item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, December 14, 2024 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Racing's Deadliest Day: How the 1955 Le Mans Disaster Changed Motorsport Forever (49 points | 28 comments)
2. Show HN: Svader – Create GPU-rendered Svelte components (115 points | 32 comments)
3. Byte Latent Transformer: Patches Scale Better Than Tokens (184 points | 45 comments)
4. I made a free Figma library packed with components for fast prototyping (133 points | 29 comments)
5. What Is Entropy? A Measure of Just How Little We Know (139 points | 55 comments)
6. Wasp (YC W21) is hiring a framework engineer to build Rails for JavaScript ( | hide)
7. Show HN: Open-sourcing my failed startup) Buzee – A file search application (14 points | 7 comments)
8. The Saga of the Color Brown in the Early Years of the PC (2023) (45 points | 11 comments)
9. Analysis of supply-chain attack on Ultralytics (48 points | 9 comments)
10. Study reveals mammoth as key food source for ancient Americans (40 points | 25 comments)
11. Ilya Sutskever NeurIPS talk [video] (152 points | 77 comments)
12. Sharing new research, models, and datasets from Meta FAIR (287 points | 50 comments)
13. Energy-Harvesting Electronic Holiday Card 2024 (126 points | 14 comments)
14. The tooth, the whole tooth and the jawbone too (14 points | 4 comments)

19. Making my first robot as a software engineer (324 points | 59 comments)
20. The Pentium FDIV bug, reverse-engineered (178 points | 37 comments)
21. Exotic new superconductors delight and confound (212 points | 60 comments)
22. Fermat's Last Theorem – how it’s going (405 points | 199 comments)
23. Noninvasive imaging method can penetrate deeper into living tissue (181 points | 21 comments)
24. Donald Bitzer has died (194 points | 21 comments)
25. Show HN: Imposter Attack – Among Us-themed infrared game made with ESP32 (183 points | 27 comments)
26. Ask HN: What should I do with meet.hn? (215 points | 142 comments)
27. Idiomatic Errors in Clojure (76 points | 34 comments)
28. Timemap.org – Interactive Map of History (1182 points | 171 comments)
29. My PhD advisor rewrote himself in bash (2010) (220 points | 92 comments)
